xxl.core.relational.tuples
Class ListTuple

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.relational.tuples.AbstractTuple
      xxl.core.relational.tuples.ListTuple
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Cloneable, Tuple
public class ListTuple
extends AbstractTuple

Implements a list-tuple where the column objects are saved in a list. This implementation might be significantly slower than the array-tuple implementation, especially when a lot of column accesses occur. For convenience, the implementation extends the abstract class AbstractTuple. 

   Tuple tuple = new ListTuple(resultSet);
creates a tuple for the given result set. A LinkedList is used to store elements. 
   ListTuple.FACTORY_METHOD.invoke(resultSet);
does the same.

See Also:

Field Detail

FACTORY_METHOD

public static final Function<Object,ListTuple> FACTORY_METHOD
A factory method that constructs objects of the class ListTuple. The function can be called with one or a list of parameters (similar (not equal) to the two constructors of the class - equal to the parameters of ArrayTuple):
  • resultSet: a result set from which data and metadata is taken. 
           ResultSet resultSet = ...;
       Tuple t = ListTuple.FACTORY_METHOD.invoke(resultSet);
  • objects: a list of arguments containing the objects.
    Caution: tuple is linked (not copied). So, changes to the original variables will cause changes to the tuple! List
